name: The Westin Riverwalk, San Antonio

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: from day one everything was great from check in to check out if you are in San Antonio this is the place to stay and right on the riverwalk is a added plus very nice hotel!!!! The hotel inside and out is beautiful and the service is bar none very enjoyable!!!!
reviews.title: what a great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay at the Westin Riverwalk. From the beginning, we were treated with respect and kindness. Danielle, at the front desk, recognized that it was our anniversary, and upgraded our room. Adding an additional touch of class, she had a bottle of champagne with chocolate covered strawberries delivered to our room when we returned from dinner. It was the first time we've taken a trip on our anniversary without the kiddos (13 years), and we were extremely impressed and thankful for the warmth and consideration the hotel staff demonstrated.
reviews.title: Weekend Trip
Zocca
reviews.text: I want to thank Joe Fraga the Director of Engineering for recommending Zocca for our employee appreciation meal and the manager Jose De La Vega for the attention and great customer service we received when we arrived. The service provided was beyond what we expected and the food was incredible and full of flavor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Zocca is the BEST Italian restaurant we have been to and I will definitely recommend to my friends and family.
reviews.title: OK stay in spite of bad service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a lovely, relatively well kept property but the staff all seem either completely new or just totally incompetent. Ask the simplest question and get a blank stare... that's if a staff member is even available.
reviews.title: Nice Weekend Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We LOVE the Westin. We have stayed here before and ALWAYS get great service. We were in SA this weekend for the George Strait show. Unfortunately, when I booked our hotel, the Westin was all booked up. We had to Choose the Hyatt on the Riverwalk. We arrived to the Hyatt on Friday. The staff was nice enough. The room was SUB PAR at best. Hair in the shower, funny smell. There was a LOUD dog on our floor who barked most of the early evening (maybe he was lonely for his family). Kids ran up and down the hall screaming. I love kids and dogs, but the walls were so thin it sounded like they were in the room with us. Around 2:15 AM, some drunk guy was on a rant in the hallway. This in turn got the dog riled up. It sounded like people were going into the hall to see what the hell was going on. I called security. I like a few drinks too, but this was a circus. I have no idea if they ever came up or not. About every 2 hours, someone else would be disorderly in the hall yelling (drunks). By 7am, I was livid. I got online, found a room was available at the Westin. I called there to confirm. I spoke to a wonderful helpful lady named Danielle. I explained the situation, that we needed a room. We had to check in at the concert at 3pm, and the Westin's check in is 3pm. Danielle told us to come over right away, they could accomodate us. She was very apologetic about our bad night at the Hyatt. This was ironic, because NO ONE at the Hyatt had been sorry at all. We booked the room, packed our stuff and got to the front desk of the HYATT. I had made sure that we would not get some random fee for leaving early. They assured me they would waived the "Early departure fee". No one ever apologized, asked if they could smooth things over. The best they could do was for us to come down around noon to SEE if they could find a room on another floor. However, she said we might get there at noon, and they would be unable to accomodate a change. "We are very busy due to the concert." At the front desk, The guy who checked me out said "So everything was fine except the little noise last night? I said "It was way more than a little noise. Plus, there was hair in the shower and a funny smell." He NEVER APOLOGIZED FOR EITHER OF THOSE THINGS. NEVER ASKED FOR MORE INFO ABOUT THOSE COMPLAINTS. Then he said "Yes, it is probably better that you are leaving. With the concert tonight, it will be much worse. Maybe next time you come, there will not be a show going on." We left there ASAP, went to the Westin. It was probably about 8-8:30 am at this time. Matt checked us in. He was super friendly, and super accomodating. We briefly told him how we came to be there so early. Again, he was very apologetic for our bad luck. He scanned the roster, and found us a room we could go to right away. As usual, we had a great room. The staff was wonderful. On a side note, there were A LOT of people there at the Westin for the George Strait show. We were not awakened ONCE during the night. The walls must be thicker there or something. Keep up the great work, Westin. We will see you next trip.
reviews.title: TOP OF THE LINE!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I needed a vacation, since it was the first time we have been away from our three year old daughter, we decided to have a "staycation". From the moment we arrived to moment we left we were treated wonderfully. Being from SA and with the George Straight concert going on we were not sure how things would go.I must say the staff was wonderful!!! We reserved a king suite and were put in a double bed room. When I called to let them know, they corrected the mistake promptly. The hotel is located on a very relaxing part of the Riverwalk, great people watching and none of the craziness that can happen there. JR Vasques, Guest Service Supervisor, was AMAZING!!! I recommend The Westin to anyone who needs a vacation or a staycation. Again, thank you JR for all of your service, you are one of the reasons we WILL be returning.
reviews.title: A Staycation

reviews.text: Exquisite, is the correct definition which comes to mind, to describe my experience at the hotel. Flawless stay, got a wonderful upgraded Suite room. Appreciate the fact that Mr. Bill Petrella, GM of the hotel, himself ensured that I have a wonderful stay.
reviews.title: Exquisite
Nice location on Riverwalk
reviews.text: Zocca, the Italian restaurant has great food and service, am very impressed. Also wanted to recognize Eugene Schlaff, stewarding manager; for making sure that everything went well. Within the restaurant wanted to appreciate services of AM servers Danny, Daniel, Jhezzie R & Naren. Also from the kitchen, cook Jessy took care of ensuring, that my special dietery food was excellent. Cook Martin also was there to help anytime.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would give it a 3.5 if I could, not a "4". Nice Riverwalk location with one of the nicer bars on the Walk, and a good coffee kiosk for light breakfast. The expected comfortable heavenly beds, and a nice compact outside pool area. Nice public areas. Having said that, though I am an SPG Corporate Preferred member with reservations made well in advance, we were first given the room right next to the spa/workout room--some "eligible-for-an-upgrade" loyalty, eh? They did change our room after we requested a change, which made me wonder why they couldn't have given us the better location in the first place. Some reward for loyalty involvement. No bellman or outside staff was around when we arrived by cab in mid-afternoon. That's a first at a good-sized hotel after many years of travel. They then asked if we wanted the bags brought up when we registered. So I gather there was a bellman somewhere. The bathrooms are small, tub and one sink, bathroom in same room with no separation. The AC doesn't seem to filter the humidity out as well as it does in the hall. As to having a balcony, I would best liken it to a decoration. Standing room for two, and not worth the effort. Thus, our rating of "average", which is an improvement over what I would have rated it on our first day.
reviews.title: Great location, get a Riverwalk view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 1st stay at The Westin, impromptu getaway... searched all week because the wrong hotel location/service would have defeated the purpose ...we hit the Jackpot with the Westin Riverwalk...completely stress free from the time we drive up to Valet to the time we left. Everyone was extremely courteous....our suite was heavenly...riverwalk area was secluded and peaceful..variety of fun in walking distance...everything was just what the doctor ordered!!
reviews.title: #exhale

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Westin Riverwalk had the most amazing service. Very clean, luxurious rooms. The Heavenly Bed was perfect after a day of walking the Riverwalk. Very good location, central to everything. The food at the restaurant was good.
reviews.title: AMAZING!! We will stay there everytime we visit San Antonio.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to see George Strait and decided to pay for the "Romance Package", which included strawberries and champagne. We asked for that to be delivered at 9:00 and went out on the town. Returning at 9:00, we found nothing so waited 20 minutes and still nothing was delivered. A call to the front desk got the excuse we heard all weekend "we've been busy", and a promise to expedite the order. After waiting another 25 minutes, we went to the front desk and told them to just cancel the order and give us a credit. The night manager seemed amused by the experience.
reviews.title: Can't Handle Busy Weekends

reviews.text: Later, we discovered that there is only one robe in the room - which two staff people explained was Westin policy. The next night they delivered the strawberries and champagne (unasked), but we had been to the concert and filled up on junk food and beer at the Alamodome, so didn't want anything else. In addition, there was only 1 plate, napkin, and fork delivered with the order. It never dawned on the hotel that a "Romance Package" should include two of everything!
reviews.title: Hotel review 5-27/28-2012

reviews.text: The maid didn't make up the room until after 3:00, and was in such a hurry to finish managed to only make up the bed and drop off fresh soap. Our glasses from the night before were left in the room.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is absolutely nothing wrong with this hotel but I don't quite understand all the raves about service. Stayed here over Memorial Day Weekend. We had a good rate that included parking and internet. The staff were all fine but no more service oriented than at any other hotel chain in this category. It's a service business.The first night we noticed a leak in the bathroom which seemed to cause the carpet in a small area outside the bathroom to be wet. Before going out for the day we called simply to notify them---it wasn't a big deal. When we got back around 3 we noticed room hadn't been serviced and panels from the ceiling were on the floor. There was a message to call the front desk who informed us they would have to move us. We called, they said they would call right back with new room #. We repacked then waited at least 30 minutes. When they didn't call we called back and the young woman seemed a bit flustered and they put us in 1015, a corner suite. Much nicer than 909 but I feel it took too long to provide us with new room #. Hotel wasn't too busy that day. 909 and 1015 were both riverside but too high to see the river very well, and 909 had no chairs on the balcony. 909 clean and pleasant but forgettable. 1015 more nicely decorated. Go for the corner suites if you can and ask for a lower floor. Lots of hotels on the riverwalk so if we were to return we would probably try one of the others.
reviews.title: Room 909 to #1015

reviews.text: I needed to get out and see the city but had little time. The concierge called Jose Alvarado, I believe he is the bell captain, and explained what I wanted. Jose went out of his way to get a cab driver who showed me the highlights of San Antonio is about 1 1/2 hours, for a very modest charge. I had a great time...because of Jose, the hotel staff in general, and the charm of the city, I will come back to visit.
reviews.title: It's the little things...

reviews.text: I spent the night at this hotel on the riverwal on June 3rd, 2013.
reviews.title: Glorious hotel but pathetic front desk check-in staff

reviews.text: After coming in from a long and challenging business day I went to check-in and the 3 girls behind the check-in counter acted as though I wasn't worth their time. A gentlemen walked up shortly after I did and the 3 girls were falling all over themselves trying to 'chat it up' with him and couldn't even take the time to direct me to the elevator!
reviews.title: Excellent customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had it not been for JR Vasquez taking the time to stop and ask me if I needed any help, I probably wouldn't have much nice to say. He not only got me to the elevator but gave me a dinner suggestion (which turned out to be fabulous). For someone like me who had never been there before, I really appreicated his customer service attitude.
reviews.title: Outstanding Weekend Visit

aka: The Westin Riverwalk Hotel San Antonio
description: Located on the world famous Riverwalk in San Antonio, The Westin Riverwalk is in the perfect location to relax and recharge. Expect a warm welcome when you visit our hotel.
